Traffic Jam Winners!

Now presenting the winners of the MakeCode Arcade Traffic Jam! We had a record number (100+!) of submissions, and the entire MakeCode team has been enjoying your games. Check out our live stream showcasing a few of the honorable mentions as well as the winners, and browse the full gallery of submissions at the bottom of this page.

First Place: Square Rescue
 

Square Rescue by donnadie has it all: an awesome opening, evil triangles, and a core mechanic that’s easy to understand but has a lot of depth. It’s the best kind of difficult that makes your brain bend in interesting ways to learn how to win. It might take a while to figure out, but keep playing. The satisfaction of rescuing those squares is worth it.

Second Place: HONK!
 

Unsigned_Arduino’s HONK! is, at it’s heart, a game that is just incredibly fun to play! Take a moment to enjoy the creative title screen and instructions sequence, then press the A button to HONK! other cars out of your way. Keep an eye out for powerups as you speed up–you’ll need them!

Third Place: Traffic Panic
 

Traffic Panic from I Am Penguin is a well-designed and thoughtful puzzler with a high difficulty curve. Arrange the randomly generated road segments into a continuous street before the cars arrive! Later levels introduce new mechanics like trees, or slow-down lights that can give you a little more time to quickly lay out roads.

Honorable Mentions

These are some games that didn’t make the top three, but the judges loved! Give them a play, we’re sure you’ll enjoy yourself.

   


Traffic Jam by Rishi
A classic puzzle game with a fun twist–can you beat level nine?

UFOs control traffic by logic_lab
Prevent car crashes as a helpful UFO traffic controller and admire the beautiful art as you do!


Gridlock Panic by Colin
An entertaining game with a dose of realism: survive gridlock while keeping the cars around you happy.

Split cars by LCProCODER
Play on hard mode using the player one and two keyboard controls to move the cars, or grab a friend to help you out.


Speedup by limeboat
A one player racing game with a variety of levels! Drift around corners and try to beat the author’s best times.

Two player Car racing by Dreadmask197
A simple but very well-executed racing game; find a friend and see who can reach three laps first.


Box Cars by Lucas the Game Builder
An in-depth racing game with NPCs, difficulty modes, and a wide variety of levels! Can you beat Rainbow Road?

Perpetual Racer v1.0 by Flint
An infinite racer game where you must avoid other cars and stay on the road.


Traffic by SergioF
Deliver packages quickly, but avoid the rival cars on the street as you go.

EL TAXI A TODA LECHE by Diego
Stay on the road and keep an eye on the clock as you pick up customers in your taxi!


Corre Coche Corre by Dylan
Dodge rocks and keep your car full of gas in this game! Can you find the Easter egg?



Late for Work by Connor
A challenging racer where you must dodge oil spills and barricades on your way to work.
